sentences: Bobby Ray Simmons Jr. (born November 15, 1988), known professionally as B.o.B, is an American rapper and record producer from Decatur, Georgia.

sentences: On February 24, 2015, B.o.B. appeared on Tech N9ne's "Hood Go Crazy", alongside 2 Chainz, which received moderate success.

sentences: It features guest appearances from singers Jon Bellion and Sevyn Streeter.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2017: Psycadelik Thoughtz and Elements series ===

sentences: The commercial mixtape, which was released without any promotion or pre-release singles, debuted at number 97 on the US Billboard 200 chart.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2017: Psycadelik Thoughtz and Elements series ===

sentences: Having released multiple projects with Atlantic, including three extended plays (EPs), three studio albums and a retail mixtape, the two sides separated soon after B.o. B claimed that the label was "suppressing" him.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2017: Psycadelik Thoughtz and Elements series ===

section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2017: Psycadelik Thoughtz and Elements series ===

section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2017: Psycadelik Thoughtz and Elements series ===

sentences: The mixtape, titled FIRE, follows the concept of his previous one, adopting the title of an element and the use of acronyms.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015–2017: Psycadelik Thoughtz and Elements series ===

== Artistry == | === Musical style ===

sentences: Musical style ===
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style ===

sentences: In a 2009 interview, when asked about his music B.o. B said: "I try to be more personal than try to be different".
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style ===

sentences: In a review for his debut album The Adventures of Bobby Ray (2010), HipHopDX wrote: "The versatility that B.o. B encapsulates is evident from the outset of the album."
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style ===

sentences: B.o. B sings, raps, plays the piano and the guitar, all throughout his debut.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style ===

sentences: He utilizes pop music, political hip hop, trap music, rock music, and club music, often dividing himself into two personas that handle specific genres; the B.o. B alter ego is responsible for the pop, trap and club music, while Bobby Ray is the more heartfelt multi-instrumentalist who shares his views through conscious rap and rock music.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style ===

sentences: Simmons heavily explored this concept on his 2009 mixtape B.o. B vs. Bobby Ray, and later on the 2012 single "Where Are You (B.o. B vs. Bobby Ray)".
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style ===
== Beliefs ==

sentences: Beliefs ==
section: == Beliefs ==

sentences: B.o. B is an outspoken conspiracy theorist and is noted for his anti-establishment views, which he has expressed in interviews, social media and his music.
section: == Beliefs ==

sentences: He has also been vocal on several social and political issues, including the rights of African Americans, police brutality and American exceptionalism.
section: == Beliefs ==

sentences: He believes that the Earth is flat, the 1969 moon landing was faked, 9/11 was an inside job, the world will be taken over by the Illuminati and celebrity cloning is administered by the U.S. government.
section: == Beliefs ==

sentences: B.o.
section: == Beliefs ==

sentences: B's 2016 song "Flatline" alludes to antisemitic conspiracy theories, asking his audience to "Do [their] research" on Holocaust denier David Irving, adding "Stalin was way worse than Hitler / That's why the POTUS gotta wear a Kipper [kippah]."
section: == Beliefs ==

sentences: These comments gained the attention of the Anti-Defamation League, which stated the lyrics invoke the antisemitic conspiracy theory that  alleges Jews control the U.S. government.
section: == Beliefs ==

sentences: "Flat Earth" belief ===

sentences: Astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson responded to B.o.
section: == Beliefs == | === "Flat Earth" belief ===

sentences: B on Twitter and attempted to persuade him that the Earth is round, but the rapper refused to retract his views and accused NASA of avoiding questions, while releasing a diss track against Tyson.

sentences: The track, titled "Flatline", expands on B.o.
section: == Beliefs == | === "Flat Earth" belief ===

sentences: B.'s views about the shape of the Earth.

sentences: Tyson and his rapper nephew, Stephen, responded to B.o.

sentences: B's flat Earth diss with their own diss track titled "Flat to Fact".

section: == Beliefs == | === "Flat Earth" belief ===

sentences: And by the way, this is called gravity" Tyson said, dropping his mic.
